misconceptions.inferred_category_name: No misconception detected (correct loop + conditional accumulation)
misconceptions.student_thought_process: The student believes they should iterate exactly 5 times, read one integer each time, test whether it is even using n % 2 == 0, and add only even values to an accumulator before printing the final sum.
misconceptions.conceptual_gap: No gap detected. This matches Java’s execution model: the loop runs 5 iterations, nextInt() consumes 5 integers from input, the accumulator y updates only when the condition holds, and the final print reflects the computed sum.
misconceptions.error_manifestation: None (produces correct output for valid integer input).
